column4: Foxconn says in preliminary discussions to expand U.S. operations
column5: TAIPEI Foxconn  the world's largest contract electronics manufacturer and a major Apple Inc  supplier  said on Wednesday that it was in preliminary discussions to expand its operations in the United States. | Video

column4: SoftBank's Son pledges $50 billion  Foxconn eyes U.S. expansion as Trump woos Asian firms
column5: NEW YORK Two of Asia's biggest technology companies said they were looking to expand investment in the United States  as President-elect Donald Trump pushes to bring manufacturing and jobs back home. | Video

column4: Discounts  advertising spur brisk Apple Watch sales
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Watch sales appear to have rebounded for the holidays from mid-year doldrums on a redesign  price cuts and strong promotions  but analysts say long-term demand has yet to be proven. | Video

column4: U.S. Supreme Court backs Samsung in smartphone fight with Apple
column5: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday sided with Samsung in its big-money smartphone patent fight with Apple  throwing out an appeals court ruling that the South Korean company had to pay a $399 million penalty to its American rival for copying key iPhone designs.

column4: Costco's profit beats estimates on higher store traffic
column5: Warehouse club retailer Costco Wholesale Corp  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit  helped by increased store traffic and higher sales of fresh foods.

column4: EpiPen maker Mylan to restructure  cut workforce
column5: Generic drugmaker Mylan NV   which has been under fire for price hikes on the life-saving EpiPen allergy treatment  said on Wednesday that it expected to cut less than 10 percent of its workforce in a restructuring to integrate acquisitions.

column4: Royal Caribbean  Norwegian get Cuba go-ahead for cruises
column5: U.S cruise operators Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd and Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday they had got approval from Cuban authorities to begin operations to the country.

column4: Staples to sell controlling stake in European unit to Cerberus
column5: Office supplies retailer Staples Inc  said it would sell a controlling stake in its European business to private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management LP for 50 million euros ($53.65 million) to focus on its North American operations.

column4: Pandora looking at bidders beyond Sirius XM: CNBC
column5: Internet radio provider Pandora Media Inc is looking at potential acquirers beyond satellite radio company Sirius XM Holdings Inc  CNBC reported  citing sources.

column4: Starbucks courts millennials with $10 coffee at new Reserve bars
column5: LOS ANGELES/NEW YORK Starbucks Corp Chief Executive and co-founder Howard Schultz's plan to build a new prestige brand is a bet that moving upscale can raise the profile of the world's largest coffee brand with millennials like Megan Sauers.

column4: Starbucks sets five-year growth targets  to open 12 000 more stores
column5: Starbucks Corp  unveiled a five-year growth plan  under which it would open more stores around the world  including several high-end coffee shops  while targeting annual revenue growth of 10 percent.

column4: SunPower CEO expects solar panel prices decline to stop next year
column5: The freefall in solar panel prices would likely stop next year and the industry would improve in the latter half of 2017  the chief executive of SunPower Corp   the No. 2 U.S. solar panel maker  said on Wednesday.

column4: New TD Ameritrade CEO Hockey to boost tech spend by 25 percent
column5: NEW YORK TD Ameritrade Holding Corp is boosting its technology spending by around 25 percent in an effort to increase the speed and scope of technological innovation at the No. 1 online broker by trading volume  its chief executive officer said on Tuesday.

column4: Alaska Air wins U.S. antitrust approval for Virgin deal with conditions
column5: WASHINGTON Alaska Air Group Inc  has won U.S. antitrust approval for its $2.6 billion acquisition of Virgin America Inc  on condition that it scale back its code-sharing with American Airlines Group Inc   the Justice Department said on Tuesday.

column4: Exclusive: Aon explores $5 billion benefits outsourcing unit sale - sources
column5: Insurance broker Aon Plc  is exploring a sale of a division that other companies use to outsource the administration of employee benefits  potentially valuing it at more than $5 billion  people familiar with the matter said.

column4: AT&T touts Time Warner merger at U.S. Senate hearing
column5: WASHINGTON AT&T Inc's  planned $85.4 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc  will increase innovation and bring "better-priced options" to consumers upset by high cable bills  AT&T Chief Executive Randall Stephenson told lawmakers on Wednesday. | Video

column4: Chile rejects attempt to block modified Barrick Gold mine project
column5: SANTIAGO/TORONTO Chile has rejected an attempt by local communities to block modifications needed to keep Barrick Gold Corp's  controversial Pascua Lama project alive  a resolution by the ministerial committee involved showed on Wednesday.

column4: BlackRock adjusts leadership team for its largest mutual fund
column5: NEW YORK BlackRock Inc  is making leadership changes to its biggest mutual fund.

column4: BlackRock 'less committed' to specific targets  but forecasts growth
column5: NEW YORK A top BlackRock Inc executive said the world's largest asset manager could benefit from rising interest rates as its clients keep their stakes in bonds and as revenues from other businesses grow.

column4: Trump defends Boeing tweet  says companies shouldn't worry
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Wednesday defended his direct interventions with companies  including making statements on Twitter  saying businesses will benefit from his actions and his upcoming term in office.

column4: Trump on Boeing's Air Force One contract: 'Cancel order!'
column5: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK U.S. President-elect Donald Trump urged the government on Tuesday to cancel an order with Boeing Co for a revamped Air Force One - one of the most prominent symbols of the U.S. presidency - saying costs were out of control. | Video

column4: Exclusive: In mammoth task  BP sends almost three million barrels of U.S. oil to Asia
column5: SINGAPORE Oil major BP  is shipping almost three million barrels of U.S. crude to customers across Asia  pioneering a lengthy and complex operation likely to become more popular after OPEC last week announced deep production cuts.

column4: EU clears Bristol-Myers immunotherapy drug for blood cancer
column5: LONDON Bristol-Myers Squibb's immunotherapy drug Opdivo has been approved in Europe for the treatment of classical Hodgkin lymphoma  a rare blood cancer  the U.S. company said on Wednesday.

column4: Citigroup fourth-quarter markets revenue trending up 20 percent vs year ago
column5: NEW YORK Citigroup Inc fourth-quarter markets revenue is running about 20 percent higher than last year  chief financial officer John Gerspach said on Wednesday.

column4: Hidden credit card perks can save shoppers
column5: NEW YORK Want to save a few quick bucks on your holiday shopping? Your credit card may offer some little-known perks that could save you money both upfront and after the purchase.

column4: Credit Suisse's Thiam steps up cost cuts  lowers profit goals
column5: ZURICH Credit Suisse  on Wednesday pledged to cut another 1 billion Swiss francs ($991 million) in costs and pared back profit targets amid challenging markets which have made it harder for banks to make money.

column4: Credit Suisse CEO says has good reason to believe conditions improving
column5: ZURICH Challenging market conditions could be set to improve  Credit Suisse  Chief Executive Tidjane Thiam said on Wednesday.

column4: FIS to sell public sector  education unit to Vista Equity for $850 million
column5: Software maker Fidelity National Information Services Inc (FIS) is to sell its SunGard Public Sector and Education unit to Vista Equity Partners for $850 million to focus on making software for the financial industry.

column4: Fitbit buys smartwatch maker Pebble's software assets
column5: Wearable device maker Fitbit Inc  said it had bought smartwatch maker Pebble's software and intellectual property as it looks to strengthen its position in the wearables market.

column4: Ford releases for sale half of 10-speed F-150 stockpiled trucks
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co  by Wednesday had released for sale more than half of the 15 000 F-150 pickup trucks with 10-speed transmissions that were held to ensure quality  a company spokeswoman said.

column4: Ford makes contingency plans in case of China year-end tax surprise
column5: BEIJING Ford Motor Co  expects China to wait until the last possible moment to announce whether it will extend a tax cut on small engine cars set to expire at year's end and is making contingency plans for various outcomes  an executive said on Wednesday.

column4: GNC settles dietary supplements case with U.S. government
column5: WASHINGTON GNC Holdings Inc  the largest global dietary supplement retailer  has agreed to pay $2.25 million to avoid federal prosecution over its alleged sale of illegal dietary supplements  the U.S. Department of Justice said on Wednesday.

column4: GoDaddy’s HEG buyout backed with $1.91 billion of loans
column5: LONDON US-based website domain name provider GoDaddy’s €1.69bn ($1.81 billion) acquisition of peer Host Europe Group will be backed with $1.907bn of loans  the company said.

column4: ICE told to speed up investigations on U.S. futures exchange
column5: NEW YORK Intercontinental Exchange Inc  generally takes too long to complete investigations into questionable trading practices on its U.S. futures exchange as required by the rules  the regulator said.

column4: Interpublic says U.S. government sought video production data
column5: NEW YORK Interpublic Group of Cos  one of the world's biggest advertising companies  said on Wednesday that the U.S. Justice Department had asked one of its standalone domestic agencies for documents regarding video production practices.

column4: J&J questions fairness of hip implant trial  $1 billion verdict
column5: Johnson & Johnson  will challenge the fairness of a trial that produced a verdict of $1 billion in damages against the company last week over allegations of design flaws in its  Pinnacle hip implant.

column4: U.S. Steel could restore up to 10 000 U.S. jobs - CEO tells CNBC
column5: United States Steel Corp  could be looking at restoring up to 10 000 jobs in the United States  Chief Executive Mario Longhi told CNBC  without providing a timeline for the additions.

column4: China says fines Medtronic local unit $17.2 million for price fixing
column5: BEIJING/SHANGHAI A Chinese regulator has fined a local unit of U.S.-listed medical device firm Medtronic PLC 118.5 million yuan ($17.20 million) for price fixing  the National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC) said in a statement on Wednesday.

column4: Pandora looking at bidders beyond Sirius XM: CNBC
column5: Internet radio provider Pandora Media Inc is looking at potential acquirers beyond satellite radio company Sirius XM Holdings Inc  CNBC reported  citing sources.

column4: Pioneer Energy to sell rigs as part of fleet modernization strategy
column5: Land rig provider Pioneer Energy Services  will sell two of its rigs next week as part of a move to decrease its exposure to older electric rigs  Chief Executive Stacy Locke told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: Linde resumes merger talks with Praxair  CEO resigns
column5: FRANKFURT Germany's Linde agreed to revive talks with U.S. rival Praxair  to create a $65 billion industrial gases giant which will have its main operations run from Connecticut  two sources familiar with the deal said on Wednesday.

column4: Merged Praxair  Linde to 50:50 percent owned by each: sources
column5: FRANKFURT Praxair's and Linde's shareholders are to own equal parts in the industrial gases group created by a proposed merger of the two companies  people close to the deal said.

column4: Parts of mooted Praxair-Linde group to be run out of Germany: sources
column5: FRANKFURT Praxair enticed prospective merger partner Linde into resuming negotiations by offering to locate some central functions of the combined group in Germany  two people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: Britain's spending watchdog may review RBS privatization process
column5: LONDON Britain's spending watchdog may open an investigation into the government's decision to start selling shares in Royal Bank of Scotland last year causing a 1.1 billion pound ($1.39 billion) loss for taxpayers  sparking accusations of poor timing from opposition politicians.

column4: Royal Caribbean  Norwegian get Cuba go-ahead for cruises
column5: U.S cruise operators Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd and Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday they had got approval from Cuban authorities to begin operations to the country.

column4: Sony's PlayStation 4 sales top 50 million units worldwide
column5: TOKYO Sony Corp said on Wednesday sales of its PlayStation 4 video game console had exceeded 50 million units as of Dec 6 helped by strong demand during the year-end holiday season.

column4: Sony to release six smartphone games to accelerate mobile drive
column5: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp  will release as many as six smartphone games in the next financial year  hoping that its own gaming franchises can replicate the success of console rival Nintendo Co's  Pokemon GO.

column4: Sprint to partner with Pokemon Go developer
column5: Sprint Corp said on Wednesday it would partner with the developer of Pokemon Go  Niantic Inc  in a bid to pull fans of the wildly popular location-based game into more than 10 500 of its stores in the United States.

column4: Solvay to sell cigarette filter business Acetow to Blackstone
column5: BRUSSELS Belgian chemicals group Solvay  said on Wednesday it had agreed to sell its Acetow unit  which makes material used in cigarette filters  to private equity group Blackstone  for 1 billion euros ($1.07 billion)  including debt.

column4: AT&T touts Time Warner merger at U.S. Senate hearing
column5: WASHINGTON AT&T Inc's  planned $85.4 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc  will increase innovation and bring "better-priced options" to consumers upset by high cable bills  AT&T Chief Executive Randall Stephenson told lawmakers on Wednesday. | Video

column4: U.S. Steel could restore up to 10 000 U.S. jobs - CEO tells CNBC
column5: United States Steel Corp  could be looking at restoring up to 10 000 jobs in the United States  Chief Executive Mario Longhi told CNBC  without providing a timeline for the additions.

column4: Exclusive: U.S. regulator set to fail Wells Fargo on community lending test - sources
column5: WASHINGTON A U.S. bank regulator is ready to fail Wells Fargo on a national scorecard for community lending  sources familiar with the decision said on Wednesday  in a move that could limit near-term expansion for the bank.

column4: Wells Fargo expects short term profit hit from interest rates rise: CEO
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  will see a near-term profit hit because of the sharp rise in interest rates  Chief Executive Officer Tim Sloan said on Tuesday.
